results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of non-derangement permutations of {1,2,...,n} having genus k (see first comment for definition of genus).
comment: The genus g(p) of a permutation p of {1,2,...,n} is defined by g(p)=(1/2)[n+1-z(p)-z(cp')], where p' is the inverse permutation of p, c = 234...n1 = (1,2,...,n), and z(q) is the number of cycles of the permutation q.
The sum of the entries in row n is A002467(n).
The number of entries in row n is floor(n/2).
reference: S. Dulucq and R. Simion, Combinatorial statistics on alternating permutations, J. Algebraic Combinatorics, 8 (1998), 169-191.
example: T(3,0)=4 because all non-derangements of {1,2,3}, namely 123=(1)(2)(3), 132=(1)(23), 213=(12)(3), and 321=(13)(2) have genus 0. This follows easily from the fact that a permutation p of {1,2,...,n} has genus 0 if and only if the cycle decomposition of p gives a noncrossing partition of {1,2,...,n} and each cycle of p is increasing (see Lemma 2.1 of the Dulucq-Simion reference).
maple: n := 7: with(combinat): P := permute(n): inv := proc (p) local j, q: for j to nops(p) do q[p[j]] := j end do: [seq(q[i], i = 1 .. nops(p))] end proc: nrfp := proc (p) local ct, j: ct := 0: for j to nops(p) do if p[j] = j then ct := ct+1 else end if end do: ct end proc: nrcyc := proc (p) local pc: pc := convert(p, disjcyc): nops(pc)+nrfp(p) end proc: b := proc (p) local c: c := [seq(i+1, i = 1 .. nops(p)-1), 1]: [seq(c[p[j]], j = 1 .. nops(p))] end proc: gen := proc (p) options operator, arrow: (1/2)*nops(p)+1/2-(1/2)*nrcyc(p)-(1/2)*nrcyc(b(inv(p))) end proc: NDER := {}: for i to factorial(n) do if nrfp(P[i]) > 0 then NDER := `union`(NDER, {P[i]}) else end if end do: f[n] := sort(add(t^gen(NDER[j]), j = 1 .. nops(NDER))): seq(coeff(f[n], t, j), j = 0 .. floor((1/2)*n)-1); # yields the entries in the specified row n
xref: Cf. A178514 (genus of derangements), A178515 (genus of involutions), A178516 (genus of up-down permutations), A178518 (permutations of [n] having genus 0 and p(1)=k), A185209 (genus of connected permutations).
